title: Editors Choice Pictures
text:
Pictures | Fri Mar 9, 2018 | 7:55am   
Israeli ultra-Orthodox Jewish men sit as a water canon is activated during a protest against the detention of a member of their community who refuses to serve in the Israeli army, in Jerusalem. REUTERS/Ronen Zvulun Reuters / Thursday, March 08, 2018 Israeli ultra-Orthodox Jewish men sit as a water canon is activated during a protest against the detention of a member of their community who refuses to serve in the Israeli army, in Jerusalem. REUTERS/Ronen Zvulun Close 1 / 24 
Protesters form triangles with their hands during a demonstration for women's rights in Bilbao, Spain, on International Women's Day. REUTERS/Vincent West Reuters / Thursday, March 08, 2018 Protesters form triangles with their hands during a demonstration for women's rights in Bilbao, Spain, on International Women's Day. REUTERS/Vincent West Close 2 / 24 
U.S. President Donald Trump gives out pens he used to sign presidential proclamations placing tariffs on steel and aluminum imports to workers from the steel and aluminum industries at the White House in Washington. REUTERS/Leah Millis Reuters / Thursday, March 08, 2018 U.S. President Donald Trump gives out pens he used to sign presidential proclamations placing tariffs on steel and aluminum imports to workers from the steel and aluminum industries at the White House in Washington. REUTERS/Leah Millis Close 3 / 24 
Claudia Kelleway lies with Ruby the Great Dane during the first day of the Crufts Dog Show in Birmingham, Britain. REUTERS/Darren Staples Reuters / Thursday, March 08, 2018 Claudia Kelleway lies with Ruby the Great Dane during the first day of the Crufts Dog Show in Birmingham, Britain. REUTERS/Darren Staples Close 4 / 24 
Paul Manafort (R), former campaign manager for U.S. President Donald Trump, arrives for an arraignment at the federal courthouse in Alexandria, Virginia. REUTERS/Brian Snyder Reuters / Thursday, March 08, 2018 Paul Manafort (R), former campaign manager for U.S. President Donald Trump, arrives for an arraignment at the federal courthouse in Alexandria, Virginia. REUTERS/Brian Snyder Close 5 / 24 
The delegation and the team of North Korea arrive at The Paralympic Village in Pyeongchang, South Korea. OIS/IOC/Thomas Lovelock/via Reuters Reuters / Thursday, March 08, 2018 The delegation and the team of North Korea arrive at The Paralympic Village in Pyeongchang, South Korea. OIS/IOC/Thomas Lovelock/via Reuters Close 6 / 24 
Women run during an event marking International Women's Day in Old Jeddah, Saudi Arabia. REUTERS/Faisal Al Nasser Reuters / Thursday, March 08, 2018 Women run during an event marking International Women's Day in Old Jeddah, Saudi Arabia. REUTERS/Faisal Al Nasser Close 7 / 24 
A man enjoys the fireworks exploding from a traditional bull figure known as "El Torito" during the annual San Juan de Dios celebrations in Tultepec, on the outskirts of Mexico City. REUTERS/Carlos Jasso Reuters / Friday, March 09, 2018 A man enjoys the fireworks exploding from a traditional bull figure known as "El Torito" during the annual San Juan de Dios celebrations in Tultepec, on the outskirts of Mexico City. REUTERS/Carlos Jasso Close 8 / 24 
The forensic tent, covering the bench where Sergei Skripal and his daughter Yulia were found, is repositioned by officials in protective suits in the centre of Salisbury, Britain. REUTERS/Peter Nicholls Reuters / Thursday, March 08, 2018 The forensic tent, covering the bench where Sergei Skripal and his daughter Yulia were found, is repositioned by officials in protective suits in the centre of Salisbury, Britain. REUTERS/Peter Nicholls Close 9 / 24 
McDonald's iconic 'M' logo is turned upside down in honor of International Women's Day in Lynwood, California. REUTERS/Mike Blake Reuters / Thursday, March 08, 2018 McDonald's iconic 'M' logo is turned upside down in honor of International Women's Day in Lynwood, California. REUTERS/Mike Blake Close 10 / 24 
Actor Mark Hamill poses with "Star Wars" characters R2-D2 and Stormtroopers after unveiling his star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame in Los Angeles. REUTERS/Mario Anzuoni Reuters / Thursday, March 08, 2018 Actor Mark Hamill poses with "Star Wars" characters R2-D2 and Stormtroopers after unveiling his star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame in Los Angeles. REUTERS/Mario Anzuoni Close 11 / 24 
Activists light flares as they march at the main shopping and pedestrian street of Istiklal during a rally on the International Women's Day in Istanbul, Turkey. REUTERS/Murad Sezer Reuters / Thursday, March 08, 2018 Activists light flares as they march at the main shopping and pedestrian street of Istiklal during a rally on the International Women's Day in Istanbul, Turkey. REUTERS/Murad Sezer Close 12 / 24 
Demonstrators hold posters as they march for more liberal Irish abortion laws, in Dublin, Ireland. REUTERS/Clodagh Kilcoyne Reuters / Thursday, March 08, 2018 Demonstrators hold posters as they march for more liberal Irish abortion laws, in Dublin, Ireland. REUTERS/Clodagh Kilcoyne Close 13 / 24 
Two young patients wait after being seen by Doctor Dmitriy Rozumiy (R) in a small clinic in the village of Ivankovichy, Ukraine. REUTERS/Gleb Garanich Reuters / Thursday, March 08, 2018 Two young patients wait after being seen by Doctor Dmitriy Rozumiy (R) in a small clinic in the village of Ivankovichy, Ukraine. REUTERS/Gleb Garanich Close 14 / 24 
Suror Abdel Karim, a female activist and a nurse from Mosul's Old City, collects the remaining bodies of the Islamic State militants, in Mosul, Iraq. REUTERS/Khalid al-Mousily Reuters / Thursday, March 08, 2018 Suror Abdel Karim, a female activist and a nurse from Mosul's Old City, collects the remaining bodies of the Islamic State militants, in Mosul, Iraq. REUTERS/Khalid al-Mousily Close 15 / 24 
A woman has her face painted before attends a march during a demonstration as part of the International Women's Day in Sao Paulo, Brazil. REUTERS/Paulo Whitaker Reuters / Thursday, March 08, 2018 A woman has her face painted before attends a march during a demonstration as part of the International Women's Day in Sao Paulo, Brazil. REUTERS/Paulo Whitaker Close 16 / 24 
Activists march at the main shopping and pedestrian street of Istiklal during a rally on the International Women's Day in Istanbul, Turkey. REUTERS/Murad Sezer Reuters / Thursday, March 08, 2018 Activists march at the main shopping and pedestrian street of Istiklal during a rally on the International Women's Day in Istanbul, Turkey. REUTERS/Murad Sezer Close 17 / 24 
An attendant is seen between curtains during the second plenary session of the Chinese People's Political Consultative Conference (CPPCC) at the Great Hall of the People in Beijing, China. REUTERS/Aly Song Reuters / Thursday, March 08, 2018 An attendant is seen between curtains during the second plenary session of the Chinese People's Political Consultative Conference (CPPCC) at the Great Hall of the People in Beijing, China. REUTERS/Aly Song Close 18 / 24 
Britain's Foreign Secretary Boris Johnson sits with Year 1 pupils from the Stingray class during a visit to St Leonard's Church of England Primary Academy in Hastings, Britain. REUTERS/Dylan Martinez Reuters / Thursday, March 08, 2018 Britain's Foreign Secretary Boris Johnson sits with Year 1 pupils from the Stingray class during a visit to St Leonard's Church of England Primary Academy in Hastings, Britain. REUTERS/Dylan Martinez Close 19 / 24 
Max Verstappen of Red Bull Racing in the pits during testing in Montmelo, Spain. REUTERS/Albert Gea Reuters / Thursday, March 08, 2018 Max Verstappen of Red Bull Racing in the pits during testing in Montmelo, Spain. REUTERS/Albert Gea Close 20 / 24 
  fighters remove a picture of Kurdistan Workers Party (PKK) leader Abdullah Ocalan in Kafr Jana village north of Afrin,   Wednesday, March 07, 2018   fighters remove a picture of Kurdistan Workers Party (PKK) leader Abdullah Ocalan in Kafr Jana village north of Afrin,   21 / 24 
A plane with a banner reading 'Support Women - Repeal the Eighth' flies over a march for more liberal Irish abortion laws, in Dublin, Ireland. REUTERS/Clodagh Kilcoyne Reuters / Thursday, March 08, 2018 A plane with a banner reading 'Support Women - Repeal the Eighth' flies over a march for more liberal Irish abortion laws, in Dublin, Ireland. REUTERS/Clodagh Kilcoyne Close 22 / 24 
South Korea's National Security Office head Chung Eui-yong makes an announcement about North Korea and the Trump administration outside of the West Wing at the White House in Washington. REUTERS/Leah Millis Reuters / Thursday, March 08, 2018 South Korea's National Security Office head Chung Eui-yong makes an announcement about North Korea and the Trump administration outside of the West Wing at the White House in Washington. REUTERS/Leah Millis Close 23 / 24 
U.S. Secretary of State Rex Tillerson meets with Djibouti's President Ismail Omar Guelleh at the Presidential Palace in Djibouti. REUTERS/Jonathan Ernst Reuters / Friday, March 09, 2018 U.S. Secretary of State Rex Tillerson meets with Djibouti's President Ismail Omar Guelleh at the Presidential Palace in Djibouti. REUTERS/Jonathan Ernst Close
